name: resource-relationship
title: Resource Relationship
description: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.
comments: Resources can be thought of as identifiable records or instances of classes and may include, but need not be limited to instances of dwc:Occurrence, dwc:Organism, dwc:MaterialEntity, dwc:Event, dcterms:Location, dwc:GeologicalContext, dwc:Identification, or dwc:Taxon.
examples: `an instance of a dwc:Organism is the mother of another instance of a dwc:Organism`; `a uniquely identified dwc:Occurrence represents the same dwc:Occurrence as another uniquely identified dwc:Occurrence`; `a dwc:MaterialEntity is a subsample of another dwc:MaterialEntity`
rdfs:comment: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.

fields.name: resourceRelationshipID
fields.title: Resource Relationship ID
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for an instance of relationship between one resource (the subject) and another (dwc:relatedResource, the object).

fields.name: subjectResourceID
fields.title: Subject Resource ID
fields.description: An identifier for the resource that is the subject of a dwc:ResourceRelationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the resource that is the subject of the relationship.

fields.name: subjectResourceType
fields.title: Subject Resource Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a subject resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary consisting of the classes of resources that can be related to each other.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nature or genre of the resource.

fields.name: subjectResourceTypeIRI
fields.title: Subject Resource Type IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the type of a subject resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nature or genre of the resource.

fields.name: subjectResourceTypeSource
fields.title: Subject Resource Type Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:subjectResourceType is given.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: relationshipType
fields.title: Relationship Type
fields.description: A relationship of a subject resource (identified by dwc:subjectResourceID) to a related resource (identified by dwc:relatedResourceID).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `same as`; `duplicate of`; `mother of`; `offspring of`; `sibling of`; `parasite of`; `host of`; `valid synonym of`; `located within`; `pollinator of members of taxon`; `pollinated specific plant`; `pollinated by members of taxon`; `on slab with`
fields.rdfs:comment: The relationship of the subject (identified by dwc:resourceID) to the object (identified by dwc:relatedResourceID).

fields.name: relationshipTypeIRI
fields.title: Relationship Type (IRI)
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the type of a dwc:ResourceRelationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/RO_0002456` (for the relation pollinated by); `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/RO_0002455` (for the relation pollinates); `https://www.inaturalist.org/observation_fields/879` (for the relation eaten by)
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the relationship type (predicate) that connects the subject identified by dwc:resourceID to its object identified by dwc:relatedResourceID.

fields.name: relationshipTypeSource
fields.title: Relationship Type Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:relationshipType is given.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: relatedResourceID
fields.title: Related Resource ID
fields.description: An identifier for the related resource (the object) of a dwc:ResourceRelationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for a related resource (the object, rather than the subject of the relationship).

fields.name: externalRelatedResourceID
fields.title: External Related Resource ID
fields.description: An identifier for the related resource (the object) of a dwc:ResourceRelationship that is not within the same dataset.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

fields.name: externalRelatedResourceSource
fields.title: External Related Resource Source
fields.description: A reference to a source outside the dataset where the related resource can be found.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: relatedResourceType
fields.title: Related Resource Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a related resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary consisting of the classes of resources that can be related to each other.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nature or genre of the resource.

fields.name: relatedResourceTypeIRI
fields.title: Related Resource Type IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for a type of related resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nature or genre of the resource.

fields.name: relatedResourceTypeSource
fields.title: Related Resource Type Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:relatedResourceType is given.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: relationshipOrder
fields.title: Relationship Order
fields.description: A numerical position of a dwc:ResourceRelationship in a set of dwc:ResourceRelationships that have the same combination of dwc:subjectResourceID, dwc:relatedResourceID, dwc:relationshipType, dwc:relationshipTypeIRI, and dwc:relationshipTypeSource.
fields.comments: One could use this term to create an ordered list of authors for a dcterms:BibliographicResource, for example. The first would have relationshipOrder=1, the second would have relationshipOrder=2.

fields.name: relationshipAccordingTo
fields.title: Relationship According To
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent responsible for asserting a dwc:ResourceRelationship.
fields.rdfs:comment: The source (person, organization, publication, reference) establishing the relationship between the two resources.

fields.name: relationshipAccordingToID
fields.title: Relationship According To ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for asserting a dwc:ResourceRelationship.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: relationshipEstablishedDate
fields.title: Relationship Established Date
fields.description: A date on which a dwc:ResourceRelationship was established.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.rdfs:comment: The date-time on which the relationship between the two resources was established.

fields.name: relationshipRemarks
fields.title: Relationship Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:ResourceRelationship.
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the relationship between the two resources.
